channel.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
channel.description: i think this would be great if this would happen so ppl cant hop on 2 accts to kill sum1 or sumthing i dont know moparisthebest alrdy said he wants to keep it to 1 acct i think n 1 post so yea and my writing is bad owell thoughts on this post plz also ppl cant train other ppls accts and get like 99 flats within a week would force ppl to pk with bad stats like on classic and would make it very fun to pk with 83 81 89

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @NoLives NoLives
item.description:
@NoLives wrote:

[quote=“Miles`, post:41, topic:402042”][quote author=5 1 link=topic=499098.msg3681099#msg3681099 date=1311535987]

For once I agree with Yoshie. MITB, I have an honest question for you. Have you ever actually played RSC? You don’t seem to have a vast knowledge on how things worked or do work to this day for that matter. I understand youre the head honcho or whatever, but maybe you should let the rule making be handled by someone else.

No, I’ve posted many times I’ve never really played RSC, I used to play RS2 but haven’t done that for a few years either. But certain rules have always been on RS2, and so probably were on RSC as well, and just because Jagex was to incompetent and/or lazy to enforce those rules, doesn’t mean that I am.

It wasn’t illegal to drop trade on RSC. It was just common sense not to do it around people and there was a risk of losing the items due to disconnect or someone else picking them up. You weren’t allowed on 2 characters on the same world, but you could be on 2 if each were in a different world. Also players can transfer items from one account to another on real RSC if they knew how to do it right and it wasn’t in the rules that it wasn’t allowed.

You’re a complete fucking tool…

In mc39 it states the rules when you start a account. You are allowed multiple characters, they can’t interact or be used to stack on main account. (Which will happen anyways)

Who cares?

Honestly, if this server is gonna go by every single RSC rule, you might as well not release it. It’s gonna be shit and turn into another Tewl server(PMG BAN EVERYONEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE)
[/quote]
I think you need to take your cock sucking attitude somewhere else you little retarded prick.[/quote]you’re gay

Read full topic

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

"Runescape rules of use" 
			"In order to keep runescape enjoyable for everyone there are a few",
			"rules you must observe. You must agree to these rules to play",
			"When using the built in chat facility you must not use any language",
			"which may be considered by others to be offensive, racist or",
			"obscene. You must not use the chat facility to harass, threaten or",

			"You must not exploit any cheats or errors which you find in the",
			"game, to give yourself an unfair advantage. Any exploits which you",
                            "find must be immediately reported to Jagex Software.",
			"You must not attempt to use other programs in conjunction with",
			"RuneScape to give yourself an unfair advantage at the game. You",
			"may not use any bots or macros to control your character for you.",
			"When you are not playing the game you must log-out. You may not",
			"circumvent any of our mechanisms designed to log out inactive",
			false);

			[b]"You must not create multiple characters and use them to help each",[/b]
                           [b] You may create more than one character, but if you do, you",
			"may not log in more than one at any time, and they must not interact",[/b]
			"with each other in any way. If you wish to form an adventuring",
			"party you should do so by cooperating with other players in the game",
			false);

			"You agree that your character and account in runescape, is the",
			"property of, and remains the property of Jagex Software. You may",
			"not sell, transfer, or lend your character to anyone else. We may",
			"delete or modify your character at any time for any reason.",
			"For instance failing to follow the rules above may be cause for",
                             "IMMEDIATE DELETION of all your characters."

			"You agree that for purposes such as preventing offensive language",
			"we may automatically or manually censor the chat as we see fit,",
			"and that we may record the chat to help us identify offenders.",

			"No Warranty is supplied with this Software. All implied warranties",
			"conditions or terms are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by",
			"law. We do not warrant that the operation of the Software will be",
			"uninterrupted or error free. We accept no responsibility for any",
			"consequential or indirect loss or damages. You use this software at",
			"your own risk, and assume full responsibility for any and all real,",
			"claimed, or supposed damages that may occur as a result of running",
			"We reserve all rights related to the runescape name, logo, web site,",
			"and game. All materials associated with runescape are protected",
			"by UK copyright laws and all other applicable national laws, and",
			"may not be copied, reproduced, republished, uploaded, posted,",
			"transmitted, or distributed in any way without our prior written",
			"consent. We reserve the right to modify or remove this game at any",
			"time. You agree that we may change this service, and these terms",
                            "and conditions, as and when we deem necessary.",
			"We accept no responsibility for the actions of other users of our",
			"website. You acknowledge that it is inpractical for us to control",
			"and monitor everything that users do in our game or post on our",
			"message boards, and that we therefore cannot be held responsible",
			"for any abusive or inappropriate content which appears on our site",
			false);

			"Occasionally we may accept ideas and game additions from the",
			"players. You agree that by submitting material for inclusion in",
			"runescape you are giving us a non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide,",
			"royalty-free license to use or modify the submission as we see",
			"fit. You agree that you will not withdraw the submission or attempt",
			"to make a charge for its use. Furthermore you warrant that you",
			"are the exclusive copyright holder of the submission, and that the",
			"submission in no way violates any other person or entity's rights",
			"These Terms shall be governed by the laws of England, and the",
			"courts of England shall have exclusive jurisdiction in all matters",</blockquote>

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @super_fran super fran
item.description:
@super_fran wrote:

[quote=“Yoshie, post:34, topic:402042”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=499098.msg3652565#msg3652565 date=1309824958]
No, I’ve posted many times I’ve never really played RSC, I used to play RS2 but haven’t done that for a few years either. But certain rules have always been on RS2, and so probably were on RSC as well, and just because Jagex was to incompetent and/or lazy to enforce those rules, doesn’t mean that I am.
[/quote]
RSC was an entirely different game, “feel,” and community from RS2. Everyone had dozens of pkers logged out at Varrock border of all different levels. Everyone had alts that fished and cooked, gathered red spider eggs, gathered monk robes, etc. for their pkers.

If you’re attempting to recreate what RSC actually was (minus the excessive botting, of course), then you can’t just follow Jagex’s playbook to the letter. Perhaps, regarding topics such as 1 or 2 max characters per PC, whether or not those characters can interact, etc. it would be better to create some poll threads to get the opinion of the people who have interest in your server?

tbh i like the rule everyone trains there own accts level up themselves everyone has an even playing field, so no1 reaches flats within the first couple weeks or even months and fun pking with 80s and magic i dont unstand why its such a problem u did it n classic why not here. this is suppose to be a replica not only do sum stuff not others another thing is that it would stop hackings
edit: for example dexto is alrdy like 85 80 96 if he had sum1 train him while he was asleep he would be 90s flats so its unfair to ppl who dont have xtra ppl to train them and i think this would make more pking tbh everyone n wild training to get flats or high level to pk and would encourage ppl to make mains instead of border pkers and rangers everyone would make mains to pk on

That rule isn’t the same as saying that a player can’t trade gear to their own alts though. A rule against account sharing would take care of your worries.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Web client only for mopar rsc

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @Yoshie Yoshie
item.description:
@Yoshie wrote:

Moparisthebest:

No, I’ve posted many times I’ve never really played RSC, I used to play RS2 but haven’t done that for a few years either. But certain rules have always been on RS2, and so probably were on RSC as well, and just because Jagex was to incompetent and/or lazy to enforce those rules, doesn’t mean that I am.

RSC was an entirely different game, “feel,” and community from RS2. Everyone had dozens of pkers logged out at Varrock border of all different levels. Everyone had alts that fished and cooked, gathered red spider eggs, gathered monk robes, etc. for their pkers.

If you’re attempting to recreate what RSC actually was (minus the excessive botting, of course), then you can’t just follow Jagex’s playbook to the letter. Perhaps, regarding topics such as 1 or 2 max characters per PC, whether or not those characters can interact, etc. it would be better to create some poll threads to get the opinion of the people who have interest in your server?

[quote=“super fran, post:30, topic:402042”]tbh i like the rule everyone trains there own accts level up themselves everyone has an even playing field, so no1 reaches flats within the first couple weeks or even months and fun pking with 80s and magic i dont unstand why its such a problem u did it n classic why not here. this is suppose to be a replica not only do sum stuff not others another thing is that it would stop hackings
edit: for example dexto is alrdy like 85 80 96 if he had sum1 train him while he was asleep he would be 90s flats so its unfair to ppl who dont have xtra ppl to train them and i think this would make more pking tbh everyone n wild training to get flats or high level to pk and would encourage ppl to make mains instead of border pkers and rangers everyone would make mains to pk on[/quote]
That rule isn’t the same as saying that a player can’t trade gear to their own alts though. A rule against account sharing would take care of your worries.

You don’t seem to have a vast knowledge on how things worked or do work to this day for that matter. But certain rules have always been on RS2, and so probably were on RSC as well, and just because Jagex was to incompetent and/or lazy to enforce those rules, doesn’t mean that I am. :)[/quote]
The thing is we don’t want the game Jagex may have originally dreamed of. We want the game we played. If you limit us to one account at a time it will do nothing drive players away. Period then end. With such a low rate we will want to afk, and fish, or train and mine, or mine and fish. There will HAVE to be something for us to pass the time with the slow ass rate or people will get bored and quit.

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @super_fran super fran
item.description:
@super_fran wrote:

[quote=“Yoshie, post:28, topic:402042”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=499098.msg3651922#msg3651922 date=1309798207]
The rule in RSC (as it is in RS2 even now) is you can have multiple accounts, but they can’t interact (trade) with each other or be logged in at the same time, and drop trading is also against the rules, right? So if this is to be close to ‘original’, then I should enforce all of those as best I can, right?
[/quote]
Actually, if you’re going to be close to the original, you’d never enforce those. I was never banned for swapping between characters, and I never had any friends banned for it. Then again, I almost never saw botters banned either, so clearly sticking to the original “script” isn’t the best approach in all cases.

Does anyone have a copy of the original rules from back then as well? I wouldn’t doubt that they had no drop-trading and such in them, I just don’t recall what was specifically “forbidden.”

Edit: I just see limiting players to only being able to log one character at a time as something that will be bad for the server. People will want to do something on an alt while pking or merching, and these people will want to be able to trade their stuff between their accounts. If you limit them and enforce it, good and “legit” players will end up banned after a time.

It’s a pointless rule on the real Runescape, and it always has been.[/quote]
tbh i like the rule everyone trains there own accts level up themselves everyone has an even playing field, so no1 reaches flats within the first couple weeks or even months and fun pking with 80s and magic i dont unstand why its such a problem u did it n classic why not here. this is suppose to be a replica not only do sum stuff not others another thing is that it would stop hackings
edit: for example dexto is alrdy like 85 80 96 if he had sum1 train him while he was asleep he would be 90s flats so its unfair to ppl who dont have xtra ppl to train them and i think this would make more pking tbh everyone n wild training to get flats or high level to pk and would encourage ppl to make mains instead of border pkers and rangers everyone would make mains to pk on

Read full topic

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @Yoshie Yoshie
item.description:
@Yoshie wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The rule in RSC (as it is in RS2 even now) is you can have multiple accounts, but they can’t interact (trade) with each other or be logged in at the same time, and drop trading is also against the rules, right? So if this is to be close to ‘original’, then I should enforce all of those as best I can, right?

Actually, if you’re going to be close to the original, you’d never enforce those. I was never banned for swapping between characters, and I never had any friends banned for it. Then again, I almost never saw botters banned either, so clearly sticking to the original “script” isn’t the best approach in all cases.

Does anyone have a copy of the original rules from back then as well? I wouldn’t doubt that they had no drop-trading and such in them, I just don’t recall what was specifically “forbidden.”

Edit: I just see limiting players to only being able to log one character at a time as something that will be bad for the server. People will want to do something on an alt while pking or merching, and these people will want to be able to trade their stuff between their accounts. If you limit them and enforce it, good and “legit” players will end up banned after a time.

It’s a pointless rule on the real Runescape, and it always has been.

Read full topic
item.source: Web client only for mopar rsc

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Yoshie, post:18, topic:402042”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=499098.msg3650593#msg3650593 date=1309710995]I don’t think one per IP is probably a very good policy, since many ISPs put a lot of people behind the same IP, and also private LANs wouldn’t allow a group of friends at the same house to play or anything. I was talking about one login per computer, enforced most likely with the client. Of course the server would monitor multiple connections per IP as well.

Also, I don’t care if people want to cheat at the rules and log in more than one at a time, tough luck.
[/quote]
So in order to create a new pker, one would have to either have two laptops up, or be forced to drop trade?

It just seems a little harsh to limit everyone to one when no one is going to be satisfied with only one account. Not to mention having to log off in order to fish for food for pking, or gather limps+eggs for str pots would get a little tedious.

I also recall that the webclient for the original Runescape (after rune_free.exe stopped being used I believe?) had a dropdown option as to how you were able to connect. By using two separate options, you could log two characters at once on the same computer.

If your goal is to stick to as close to the “original” as possible without making it so unappealing that people won’t play, I don’t really see the harm in extending it to two characters on at once, max.[/quote]

The rule in RSC (as it is in RS2 even now) is you can have multiple accounts, but they can’t interact (trade) with each other or be logged in at the same time, and drop trading is also against the rules, right? So if this is to be close to ‘original’, then I should enforce all of those as best I can, right?

Anc13ntsIsBack:

So when I bot, I won’t get banned on the forums. Just the Rsc correct?

Hmm, I’ll have to think about that.

Read full topic

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:402042”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=499098.msg3650132#msg3650132 date=1309669508]

We will probably do our best to assure that one person can only be logged into one account at a time.

I’m fairly certain that it’s ensuring one login per IP address ATM.
[/quote]

I don’t think one per IP is probably a very good policy, since many ISPs put a lot of people behind the same IP, and also private LANs wouldn’t allow a group of friends at the same house to play or anything. I was talking about one login per computer, enforced most likely with the client. Of course the server would monitor multiple connections per IP as well.

Also, I don’t care if people want to cheat at the rules and log in more than one at a time, tough luck.[/quote]

So, multiple connections are using a single IP address? That seems a bit odd…

You can’t really enforce things like that with the client, people can easily bypass it. I mean, it can always be logged rather than outright telling them they can’t log into multiple accounts, but it seems like there isn’t that much benefit.

Read full topic
item.source: Web client only for mopar rsc

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @Yoshie Yoshie
item.description:
@Yoshie wrote:

-Nothing:

The options were something like 'Use unsigned" which was the option that allowed you to multi login and “Use signed” which was default, I can’t remember the others though.

Yeah, that’s what it was. I recall there being others on the dropdown but I only remember those two since they were the only ones I used.

Read full topic

item.title: Web client only for mopar rsc
item.dc:creator: @Yoshie Yoshie
item.description:
@Yoshie wrote:

[quote=“dexto, post:19, topic:402042”]Ya it was in the java settings on their website.
i always used 2 accounts, 1 skilling, 1 pking.[/quote]
Took me a year+ to learn about it. Up until then, all my pkers were from drop trades in various locations I thought were “super secret.”

I do admit, from time to time, breaking in on other people’s drop trades and pissing them off. It was part of the appeal back then though. Everything had some sort of risk to it. Even leveling 1 def pkers had a chance of being screwed up due to no fatigue.

Read full topic
